sprite.name: Event Controller - Zone Enter
sprite.notes: Event IDs 1-33 are per-level, and not per zone or area. Using this will clear that flag and set it to start activated or deactivated.

value.title: Event ID
value.comment: This event ID will be activated when the zone loads.

value.title: Time Activated
value.comment: This value only works if Zone Enter is set to Activate Event, and sets a duration that the event ID will be activated for.

checkbox.title: Does Nothing
checkbox.comment: Makes the sprite skip it's function and delete itself.

sprite.name: Event Controller - "And" (If X AND Y, do Z)

list.title: Usage Mode
list.entry: Only while All Events are Active

list.title: Switch Mode
list.comment: This sprite works by allowing up to 4 Event IDs to be required to activate a single Event. All Event IDs must be set to a relevant value. Do not leave any as '0' - if you have less than four, you can enter the same ID into several spaces.

sprite.name: Event Controller - "Or" (If X OR Y, do Z)

list.title: Usage Mode
list.entry: Only while Any Event is Active

list.title: Switch Mode
list.comment: This sprite allows up to 4 events to trigger the same event ID. All event IDs must be set to relevant values. Do not leave any IDs as 0 - if you have less than four, you can enter the same ID into several spaces.

sprite.name: Event Controller - "Random" (If X, do Y OR Z)
sprite.notes: You do not have to use all four Random ID slots, and you can use the same ID on multiple slots. Example: A in ID1, A in ID2, B in ID3. 2/3 chance of A, 1/3 chance of B

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This event causes one of the four random IDs to trigger

list.title: Switch Mode
list.comment: Random ID is Activated or Deactivated based on this value

sprite.name: Event Controller - Chainer (If X, do Y)

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this event ID is activated, the target event ID will be activated or deactivated (depending on the mode).

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: When activated, this event ID will be switched depending on the chosen mode

value.title: Activation Delay
value.comment: If the delay is set to 0, the event will be activated instantly. If not, it will wait a specific amount of time before activating.

list.title: Switch Mode
list.comment: If delay is 0, the "after Delay" effect happens immediately.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: This event ID will be activated when the specified area is touched.

value.title: Mario Location ID
value.comment: This is the Location where 'Mario Status' is checked.

checkbox.title: Ignore Mario Location
checkbox.comment: If this is checked, the controller will only care about the status of the enemies

value.title: Enemy Location ID
value.comment: This is the Location where 'Enemy Status' is checked.

checkbox.title: Ignore Enemy Location
checkbox.comment: If this is checked, the controller will only care about the status of Mario

list.title: Mario Powerup
list.comment: Event will only be triggered if Mario's powerup matches the specified, or this is set to 0.

list.title: Mario Status
list.comment:
0 - Event is only triggered if a Player is inside the Mario Location.
1 - Event is only triggered if a Player is touching the ground while inside the Mario Location.
2- Event is only triggered if a Player is jumping or otherwise not touching the ground inside the Mario Location.
list.entry: Touching the Ground in the Location
In the Air in the Location

list.title: Usage Mode
list.comment:
0 - Event is only triggered once, when the Mario Status and Enemy Status are satisfied
1 - Event is triggered each time the Mario Status and Enemy Status are satisfied, but does not revert to the opposite state unless forced to by another controller
2 - Event is only triggered while Mario Status and Enemy Status are satisfied.
list.entry: Only while both Mario and Enemy Status are satisfied

list.title: Switch Mode
list.comment: If this option is set to "Deactivates Target", the activation modes will be reversed - for example, Activation Mode 2 will deactivate the event while you're touching the area, and reactivate it when you leave.

sprite.name: Event Controller - Multi-Chainer (If X, do Y THROUGH Z)

value.title: Start Event ID
value.comment: The activator will start running when this event ID is triggered.

value.title: End Event ID
value.comment: The activator will trigger all events from the start event ID to this event ID (including this one).

value.title: Delay
value.comment: The activator will wait this amount of time between triggering each event.

list.title: Usage Mode
list.comment:
Only while Start Event is Active: When the Start Event ID is turned off, the Multi-Chainer deactivates each event in the run, factoring in the delay value.
Tip: You can first trigger this sprite, then immediately deactivate it, with 1 set, to cause it to turn off all related events. There is no direct way to turn off targeted events without first enabling them, though.
list.entry: Only while Start Event ID is Active

value.title: Triggering Event ID

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: When the autoscroller reaches its final path point, this event is triggered.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this event ID is activated, the autoscroll will start. Deactivating the event will not stop the autoscroll.

value.title: Midway Start Node ID
value.comment: If the Midway Point has been activated, then the autoscroll will start from this node ID, and not from the first node.

list.title: Mode
list.comment: If set to 0, the screen will start scrolling when the event is activated. If set to 2, the only way to activate it is by pounding the beta arrow block (sprite 321). If set to 3, the autoscroll self-activates.

list.title: At the end
list.comment: Decides what will happen when the last node is hit. When set to 0, the scrolling will stop and the camera will put Mario in the center of the screen, if set to 1, the autoscroll will bounce back and forth between the starting and end nodes, if set to 2, the autoscroll will just stop.

value.title: "At the end" related
value.comment: If Nybble 8 is set to 1, and this is set to 1, it will cause the screen to wobble back and forth in a short distance. "2" will make the "wobbling" faster. Anything past that seems just to stop the autoscroll.

sprite.name: Environment - Water
sprite.notes:
Making Rising and Falling Water: Set the Mode, and set at least one of the Delays, as well as the Distance.

Making Permanently Rising or Falling Water: Set the Mode, and leave the Delays and Distance at 0.

Event Controlling Water - With Delays: If you are using Delays, set the Event ID, at least one Delay value, and the Distance value. When the event is active, the Water will rise and fall. When the event is turned off, the Water will immediately return to its starting position.

Event Controlling Water - Without Delays: If you are not using Delays, a Distance value is still required. When the event is activated, the Water will travel the Distance value, and stop. When the event is turned off, the Water will continue to travel its Distance value until reaching the end, and then return to its starting position.

Note on Modes 9-13 - Their usage is kinda mysterious and buggy. If you want water to fall, use one of the 9-13 modes without an event. When they are event controlled, they have odd behavior, so it's not recommended.

value.title: Delay at Top
value.comment: How long the Water stops for after Rising.

value.title: Delay at Bottom
value.comment: How long the Water stops for after Falling. Initial delay cannot be set, and always triggers instantly for its first time Rising.

value.title: Distance
value.comment: Amount of blocks the water will Rise.

checkbox.comment: Checking this removes the animated crest effect on the top portion of the sprite. Creates a 'square' look.

checkbox.title: Place behind Layer 0
checkbox.comment: Alters the Z-order slightly. Only affects location water, the zone must be set to "Normal" in the Spotlight settings.

value.comment: Match with a Location to set the area of this sprite

list.title: Coin Type
list.comment:
0 - The normal coin
1 - Drifts horizontally in Mario's direction, inside a bubble
2 - Sinks quickly in Mario's direction, inside a bubble
3 - A loose coin like when Mario kills an enemy with a Fire Flower
4 - Sinks slowly in Mario's direction, inside a bubble
5 - A loose coin like when Mario kills an enemy with a Fire Flower (May differ from 3)
(Continued Below)

value.title: Coin Type Notes (2)
value.comment:
6 - Makes the bonus sound from a 10-coin block bonus when the coin loads
7 - Floats upwards in Mario's direction
8 - Spins faster than a normal coin (?)
9 - Collected automatically when the coin loads
10 - Unknown effect, coin does not show
11 - A loose coin that seems to fall from the sky
12 - A loose coin like when Mario kills an enemy with a Fire Flower (May differ from 3)
(Continued Below)

value.title: Coin Type Notes (3)

13 - Unknown effect, coin does not show
14 - Spins much faster than a normal coin

sprite.name: Path Controlled Block Train
sprite.notes:
Options: Does nothing Speed: Does nothing Accel: Does nothing Delay: Does nothing Placement: Near the Starting Node Angles: 45/90 degree lines only, see below.
Distance from starting Path Node to the first subsequent Path Node must be a flat line, AS WELL AS be able to accommodate the full length of the train. After that, any segment length, as well as diagonals, may be used. The Block Train will zigzag until it reaches the height, and then go straight, so a 45 angle is recommended if not having it travel in a straight line.

list.title: End Animation

sprite.notes: Note about Event Activation: The effect cannot be deactivated without changing zones. However, if the event is still on when returning to the zone, the blocks will still be visible and moving. Platform Blocks are 'off' until the event is activated, though.

list.title: Type

sprite.name: Event Controller - Bowser Switch (Small "!")
sprite.notes: This switch may have bugs. Switch does not activate Red Blocks, like the other ! switches do.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: If this ID is set, the switch will only show while this event ID is activated. Slightly buggy if used with Multi Use.

checkbox.title: Falls
checkbox.comment: If this is checked, the switch will be movable by environment stuff, such as dropping down when bricks below it are destroyed, or riding along a conveyor belt

checkbox.title: Loads at Midway
checkbox.comment: If this is checked, the switch will only show if the level has been started from a midway point

checkbox.title: No Music Interrupt
checkbox.comment: If this is checked, the music will not be interrupted when the switch is pressed

list.title: Delay on Multi Use
list.comment: This will set how long the switch takes to pop up after the timer expires on a Multi Use switch

sprite.name: Event Controller - Bowser Switch (Large "!")
sprite.notes: This switch is incompatible with Multi Use. It will crash the Wii (though Dolphin handles it fine). Also, do not assign this switch to the same Event ID as any other switch, as that may cause crashing as well.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: If this ID is set, the switch will only show while this event ID is activated.

checkbox.title: Falls
checkbox.comment: If this is checked, the switch will be movable by environment stuff, such as dropping down when bricks below it are destroyed, or riding along a conveyor belt

checkbox.title: Loads at Midway
checkbox.comment: If this is checked, the switch will only show if the level has been started from a midway point

checkbox.title: No Music Interrupt
checkbox.comment: If this is checked, the music will not be interrupted when the switch is pressed

list.title: Delay on Multi Use
list.comment: This will set how long the switch takes to pop up after the timer expires on a Multi Use switch

list.title: Usage Mode
list.comment: Multi Use will crash the Wii, but somehow works in Dolphin.
